page.title: 09The Glamorgan Canal
page.content: The canal helped Pontypridd to become a town.The canal barges were used to transport coal and people.A small part of the canal still exists and is partly filled with water. This section known locally as Nightingale's Bush, is located just behind the Brown Lenox chain works.A lock still exists in the works' grounds and can be seen from the old tow-path.There is evidence of industrial waste in parts of the old canal.The Glamorgan Nature Trust has set up a nature reserve at this spot where volunteers and enthusiasts have worked hard to keep a supply of water there in which freshwater plants and animals may survive. It is interesting that so much valuable work is still taking place after the closure of the canal as a working waterway. By a pupil of Trefforest CP school.
